name: Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center
description: This year-round visitor center is located one mile from the Southwest Entrance. The visitor center offers an information desk, exhibit hall, auditorium, amphitheater (summer), park store, dining area, patio (summer), and a gift shop and cafe (summer). Free Wi-Fi is available inside.

images.title: Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center entrance in summer
images.altText: A paved path bends toward a wood building with a green roof backed by mountains
images.caption: The year-round Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center is located at the southwest entrance of the park.

images.title: Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center and parking area in winter
images.altText: A wooden building at the end of a snow-covered parking area backed by snow-covered peaks.
images.caption: The Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center and Southwest Area received up to 30 feet of snow each winter, making it a popular winter recreation destination.

images.title: Lassen Cafe & Gift
images.altText: People sitting in a small fireside dining area.
images.caption: Lassen Cafe & Gift offers food, gifts, and souvenirs.

images.title: Park Store
images.altText: Two people shopping in a small store featuring books and smaller items.
images.caption: The Park Store is open during building hours.

images.title: KYVC Patio
images.altText: People sitting at tables with taupe umbrellas on a patio at the base of a mountain.
images.caption: Seating is available on the patio in the summer and fall seasons.

images.title: KYVC Auditorium
images.altText: People sitting inside a small auditorium
images.caption: The 20-minute park film plays inside the auditorium.

images.title: Information desk and map exhibit
images.altText: A woman in a uniform and a man stand at a 3D map inside a visitor center.
images.caption: Rangers are available to assist at the information desk and map exhibit.

images.title: Exhibit Hall
images.altText: A family watches a video of lava in an exhibit hall.
images.caption: The exhibit hall includes a variety of printed and interactive displays.

operatingHours.description: Typical standard hours during the busy summer months. Hours may vary based on weather conditions, emergency situations, and staffing.
operatingHours.name: Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center

emailAddresses.description: General email address for park information.

name: Loomis Museum
description: The historic museum is located one mile from the northwest entrance of the park near Manzanita Lake. From the museum you can pick up the trail around Manzanita Lake or cross the highway to access the self-guided, interpretive Lily Pond Nature Trail. Lassen Association store is across the plaza from the Museum.

images.title: Loomis Museum
images.altText: A one-story stone building surrounded by a short stone wall.
images.caption: The historic Loomis Museum is open late-May through October.

images.title: Loomis Museum in 1933
images.altText: Two one-story stone buildings amid conifer trees fronted by a dirt road.
images.caption: The Loomis Museum and seismograph building were built in 1927.

images.title: Information desk and park store
images.altText: A young woman in a gray uniform shirt and a female visitor stand at a counter inside a museum.
images.caption: An information desk and park store are located inside in the museum.

images.title: Exhibits
images.altText: An exhibit hall filled with people. A male ranger talks with visitors at a 3D map in the foreground.
images.caption: Exhibits detail the eruption of Lassen Peak and other geology topics.

images.title: Exhibits in 1932
images.altText: A group of people including a male ranger stand inside a museum with walls lined with photos.
images.caption: The Loomis Museum originally served to showcase photographs captured by Benjamin F. Loomis.

operatingHours.description: Typical standard hours during the busy summer months. Hours may vary based on weather conditions, emergency situations, and staffing.
operatingHours.name: Loomis Museum
